title: 112_hr4265
content: The Act is titled the "Shared Responsibility in Preserving America's Future Act" and includes a surtax on millionaires contingent on the passage of a balanced budget amendment or spending limit amendment. This surtax is added as a new part to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Shared Responsibility in Preserving America's Future Act" includes a surtax on taxpayers with modified adjusted gross income exceeding $1,000,000, imposing a 5% tax for taxable years between 2012 and 2023. The "Shared Responsibility in Preserving America's Future Act" imposes a surtax on taxpayers with income over $1,000,000, increasing annually based on the cost-of-living adjustment. The "Shared Responsibility in Preserving America's Future Act" imposes a surtax on taxpayers with income over $1,000,000, increasing annually based on the cost-of-living adjustment. The threshold amount for married individuals filing separately is one-half of the amount for the taxable year. Modified adjusted gross income is calculated by reducing adjusted gross income by the excess amount. The term 'modified adjusted gross income' is defined as adjusted gross income reduced by the excess of gross income from a trade or business that is not a passive activity with respect to the taxpayer, and with respect to which the taxpayer pays wages to at least 1 full-time equivalent employee. The IRS defines modified adjusted gross income as adjusted gross income minus gross income from a non-passive trade or business where the taxpayer pays wages to at least one full-time equivalent employee. Special rules apply for nonresident alien individuals regarding income calculations. Regulations similar to section 469(l) will be prescribed by the Secretary for determining income taken into account. Special rules apply for nonresident alien individuals regarding income calculations under section 871(b) and for citizens and residents living abroad under section 911. The tax imposed under section 911 is not considered tax imposed by this chapter for certain purposes, such as determining credits under this chapter. Charitable trusts are exempt from subsection (a) if all interests are devoted to specific purposes. The tax imposed under section 911 is not considered tax imposed by this chapter for determining credits under this chapter. The application of a section is contingent on a balanced budget or spending limit amendment. The tax under section 911 is not counted for credits under this chapter. A balanced budget or spending limit amendment is required for the application of this section. If the President does not certify before September 30, 2012, this section does not apply. It will not apply after December 31, 2017, unless the amendment is ratified by then. The tax under section 911 is not counted for credits under this chapter. A balanced budget or spending limit amendment is required for the application of this section. It will not apply after December 31, 2017, unless the amendment is ratified by then. The amendment in Part VIII imposes a surtax on millionaires. It does not change the tax rate under section 15 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The effective date for these amendments is for taxable years starting after December 31, 2012.
